moves.1. Nf3: I adore the possibilities I have with this opening, it is really a dialogue with Black
moves.1... Nf6 2. g3 g6 3. Bg2 Bg7 4. O-O O-O: I always heard that symmetrical play is often weak for Black, but lets see
moves.5. Nc3 d5 6. d4 c6: Now, the fight for center control begins
moves.8... Nbd7 9. Qd2: I really want to move e4 but the bishop on g4 was a problem
moves.9... Re8 10. e4: My plan consists on both, by making some simplifications, create some pressure in center and, by forcing Black to play under my argument reach a strong position, but it is risky
moves.10... dxe4 11. Nxe4 Nxe4 12. Rxe4 Bf5 13: ? Black let me a beautiful chance to win material, but there will be a good compensation on the weakness of my castling pawn structure
If attack doesn't start now the weakness of my pawns can become a problem
moves.20... Qb6 21. Ne5 Bxe5 22. Qxe5 Rad8: The pressure in center was a constant from now, my pawns are in a difficult situation, but the Black rooks are a little beat passives behind the pawns
moves.23. d5 cxd5 24. cxd5 a6: ? I feel that 24. ..., Db4 was better
moves.25. Rb2 Qc5: My bishop seems to be a good support
moves.26. Rxb7 exd5 27. Qxe8+ Rxe8 28. Rxe8+: I'm not at all abbituate to play two rooks against a Queen, the freedom of the Queen scares me, but I have vantage on material and a strong bishop, although the pawns seems to be a problem, one af them will win
Really nice, I guess it was unexpected, and  the fact that the pawn blocks the Queen, my pawn gives the thrust, and the bishop is in the right place at the right time was amazing
